overview.label: Project overview
paragraphs: This Mount Hawke hedge had grown tall (around 4m) and needed a professional trim to keep it neat, safe, and under control.
We shaped and levelled the Leylandii for a more even appearance, focusing on a clean finish that looks sharp from the street and across the garden.
The result is a well-maintained hedge that’s easier to manage going forward and helps the whole property look tidier immediately.

faq.question: When is the best time to trim a Leylandii hedge?
faq.answer: Generally, late spring to early autumn is ideal for trimming Leylandii, depending on growth and nesting wildlife. For very tall hedges or regular maintenance, we can advise the safest timing after a quick look at the hedge.

faq.question: How often should a Leylandii hedge be trimmed?
faq.answer: Many Leylandii hedges benefit from trimming once or twice a year to keep growth even and prevent it becoming too wide or tall. The right schedule depends on how fast your hedge grows and the look you want.

faq.question: Can you reduce the height as well as trim the sides?
faq.answer: Yes. We can reduce and reshape height where appropriate to make future maintenance easier and improve the overall look. We’ll discuss the best approach based on hedge condition and access.

faq.question: Do you remove the clippings and waste?
faq.answer: Yes — we can remove and dispose of hedge waste so the area is left tidy. If you’d prefer to keep clippings for composting or green-waste bins, just let us know.
